page.title: 15LEEK ARM OF THE CALDON CANAL
page.content: The Leek arm of the Caldon Canal which was officially re-opened on 3rd April 1985,was built by James Renaie in 1901.He also constructed Rudyard Lake,the largest man-made lake on British Waterways. The canal has a tunnel 130 yards long which was closed to navigation because it had become dangerous.The cost of the repair work was 200,000 pounds.It was started in July 1984 and finished one month ahead of schedule.A group of local people who formed the Caldon Canal Society have worked since 1961 to achieve this aim.
